DataElement.preferredName: Follow-up Case Report Form Submission Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed._A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each trial subject._Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed._A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each trial subject._Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each trial subject.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each clinical trial subject.

Property.preferredDefinition: Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

Concepts.definition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg 4/2011

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: New; having no previous example or precedent or parallel.: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A schedule is an ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.: Submission; a message submitted for the judgment of others.

Concepts.definition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.
Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
